IHSG Melemah Dipengaruhi Tertundanya Kesepakatan Dagang AS-Cina
07 Nov 2019, 11:39 by Antara, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indeks Harga Saham Gabungan (IHSG) Bursa Efek Indonesia (BEI) pada Kamis, 7 November 2019, ditutup melemah seiring tertundanya kesepakatan perdagangan antara Amerika Serikat (AS) dan Cina.
IHSG ditutup melemah 51,92 poin atau 0,84 persen ke posisi 6.165,62. Sementara kelompok 45 saham unggulan atau indeks LQ45 bergerak turun 9,64 poin atau 0,98 persen menjadi 978,36.
Direktur Utama Foster Asset Management Andreas Yasakasih di Jakarta, Kamis, mengatakan pelemahan indeks dipengaruhi sentimen eksternal, terutama ditundanya kesepakatan perdagangan antara AS dan Cina.
"Harapan pertemuan antara Presiden AS Donald Trump dan Presiden Cina Xi Jinping untuk menandatangani kesepakatan perdagangan memudar, ditunda hingga Desember," katanya.
Situasi itu, lanjut dia, membuat sejumlah investor, terutama asing, melakukan aksi lepas saham seraya menanti kabar lanjutan kedua belah pihak. Berdasarkan data Bursa Efek Indonesia, investor asing membukukan jual bersih atau foreign net sell sebesar Rp1,21 triliun pada Kamis ini.
Di sisi lain, lanjut dia, investor juga sedang melakukan penyesuaian portofolio aset sahamnya menyusul adanya perombakan portofolio saham dalam Indeks MSCI (Morgan Stanley Capital International) Indonesia.
"Ada adjustment yang dilakukan investor menyusul adanya perubahan saham dalam indeks MSCI," katanya.
Sementara itu, tercatat frekuensi perdagangan saham di Bursa Efek Indonesia sebanyak 606.494 kali transaksi dengan jumlah saham yang diperdagangkan sebanyak 10,47 miliar lembar saham senilai Rp8,31 triliun. Sebanyak 111 saham naik, 308 saham menurun, dan 144 saham tidak bergerak nilainya.
Sementara itu, bursa regional antara lain Indeks Nikkei menguat 26,50 poin (0,11 persen) ke 23.330,30, Indeks Hang Seng menguat 158,60 poin (0,57 persen) ke 27.847,19, dan Indeks Straits Times menguat 23,03 poin (0,71 persen) ke posisi 3.285,72.

JCI Weakened Influenced US-China Trade Agreement Delays
Nov. 7, 2019, 11:39 by Antara, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) Composite Stock Price Index (IDX) on Thursday, November 7, 2019, closed lower as the trade agreement between the United States (US) and China was delayed.
JCI closed down 51.92 points or 0.84 percent to 6,165.62. While the group of 45 leading shares or LQ45 index moved down 9.64 points or 0.98 percent to 978.36.
Managing Director of Foster Asset Management Andreas Yasakasih in Jakarta on Thursday said the weakening of the index was influenced by external sentiment, especially the postponement of trade agreements between the US and China.
"Expectations of a meeting between US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping to sign a trade agreement fade, postponed until December," he said.
The situation, he continued, caused a number of investors, especially foreigners, to take off shares while waiting for further news from both parties. Based on data from the Indonesia Stock Exchange, foreign investors booked a net sell or foreign net sell of Rp1, 21 trillion this Thursday.
On the other hand, he continued, investors are also making adjustments to their stock portfolio following the stock portfolio reshuffle in Indonesia's MSCI (Morgan Stanley Capital International) Index.
"There are adjustments made by investors following changes in shares in the MSCI index," he said.
Meanwhile, the frequency of trading shares on the Indonesia Stock Exchange was 606,494 transactions, with 10.47 billion shares valued at Rp8.31 trillion. A total of 111 shares rose, 308 shares declined, and 144 shares did not move in value.
Meanwhile, regional exchanges including the Nikkei Index rose 26.50 points (0.11 percent) to 23,330.30, the Hang Seng Index gained 158.60 points (0.57 percent) to 27,847.19, and the Straits Times Index gained 23 , 03 points (0.71 percent) to position 3,285.72.
